descriptions.edit: Start creating and editing your test.

intro.reports: Keep track of your evaluators progress and answering status while they complete your test.
intro.answers: Quickly get feedback on you project by analyzing data from other users' answers.
intro.analytics: Take a deep look into your test and see what people are saying about it.
intro.invite: Invite evaluators to answer your test!
intro.cooperators: Add cooperators who can help you improve your project and gather data for your studies.
intro.edit: Create and customize your tasks and heuristics for your research needs.
intro.finalReport: Prepare the final report for your heuristic evaluation by selecting the elements you want to include.

Introduction.title: UX Remote LAB
Introduction.subtitle: What about doing Usability Tests in remote?
Introduction.description: Join our OpenSource project and start creating your own usability LAB and share it with friends. Researching has never been easier!

WelcomeStep.description: You are going to participate in a user test that aims to evaluate the ease of use and understanding of a digital application. This type of test helps us detect possible technological barriers and improve the experience for everyone.
WelcomeStep.phases: Throughout the test, we will guide you through different phases. In each one, you will be clearly told what to do. There are no right or wrong answers: what interests us is how you interact with the system.
WelcomeStep.summary: Here you can see a summary of the phases you will follow:
WelcomeStep.ready: When you are ready, click the button to start. You can move at your own pace and stop at any time if you need to.

PreTasksStep.title: Tasks
PreTasksStep.heading: Let's begin the tasks phase
PreTasksStep.description: You are going to complete {numTasks} tasks related to using the tool. There are no correct or incorrect answers: what matters is how you interact.
PreTasksStep.instruction: When you are ready, click the button to begin.
PreTasksStep.recordingDescription: During the tasks, we may collect different types of data to understand your interaction with the system. Depending on the specific task, the following may be recorded:
PreTasksStep.recordingNote: You will be notified before any recording begins. All data is collected solely for research purposes and handled according to privacy guidelines.

AccessNotAllowed.noAccess: You do not have access to the page you're trying to access.

intros.docSubtitle: Click to access the documentation on how to use the page
intros.discSubtitle: You will find support on our discord server.

finalReport.createHeuristics: Please create Heuristics so you can select them here.
finalReport.createUserTask: Please create Tasks so you can select them here.
finalReport.ContructionParagraph: We're working hard to improve our website. Please check back soon!

landing.feedbackTitle: Quickly get feedback on your projects
landing.feedbackSubtitle1: UX Remote LAB has been created to give a set of tools for different UX experts that want to create their own UX tests and perform it with the users.
landing.feedbackSubtitle2: COVID-19 has shown to the world that sometimes the physical presence of real users is not possible so we are here to solve this problem!
landing.uxSubtitle1: If you are a researcher, a company, or a professional that you want to perform an UX test, here you will find several tools to help to analyze and track your tests using different UX techniques.
landing.uxSubtitle2: Help us to grow up this Open Source community and join us on GitHub! :)
landing.footer: We are looking for new partners to help us to grow the project! Feel free to contact us on

help.createtest: How do I create a test?
help.createtestanswer: To create a test, begin by clicking on the plus icon, selecting Heuristic Test. Then, specify the particulars of your project. Finally, proceed to the dedicated manager page.
help.heuristictest: How I setup my Heuristic test?
help.heuristictestanswer: To set up your Heuristic test, start by accessing the 'Edit Test' option. Then, click on the plus icon button to add a title and the question to your heuristic. Next, navigate to the options section to create the answer options and their respective values. Finally, save the modifications.
help.deletetestanswer: To delete your test, navigate to the left sidebar and click on the 'Settings' button. Then, select the 'DELETE TEST' button.
help.createtemplateanswer: To create a template for your test, navigate to the left sidebar and click on the 'Settings' button. Then, select the 'CREATE TEMPLATE' option.
help.usetemplateanswer: To utilize a template, navigate to the Tests page. Under the Create Templates section, you'll find your personal templates. Additionally, you can explore public templates.
help.previewtestanswer: On the leftside bar, click on the 'Preview' option then start the test answering the questions & finally clicking the bottom right button to save and submit the preview which can be later analysed in the 'Answers' section.
help.importcsvanswer: To import your CSV, navigate to the 'Edit Test' section, then click the 'UPDATE' button. Select your CSV file containing the heuristics.
help.invitecooperatorsanswer: To invite collaborators, navigate to the manager page of your test. From there, select 'Cooperators' on the left sidebar. Click on 'Select cooperator' and enter the email of your collaborator. Choose the collaborators role, then send the invitation by clicking on the bottom right button.
help.analyseresultsanswer: To analyze your results, navigate to the manager page of your test. From there, select 'Answers' on the left sidebar. Here, you can visualize statistics, evaluators, and heuristics.
help.sendmessage: How to send a message to my cooperators?
help.sendmessageanswer: To send a message, navigate to the manager page of your test. Select 'Cooperators' from the left sidebar. Click on the three dots icon next to the cooperator you want to message. Then, choose 'Send a message' and write your message with a title and content.
help.browseAllCategories: Browse all categories to find the help you need
help.videoAltText: FAQ demonstration video showing the visual steps to solve the frequently asked question. No audio content is present in this instructional video.
